metadata.synopsis: Banter between Shadowheart and Halsin in the Shadow-cursed lands.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: Chin up, Halsin. I know you don't favour Lady Shar's darkness, but look - trees!
0.context: NodeContext: Poking fun at Halsin. Arc: Shadowheart is dedicated to Shar (and in this moment, enjoys resistance to a shadow curse that saps the strength of her companions)

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: I will not be taunted in this place - not after all it has taken from me. Show respect, or you will force my hand.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: Is that so? It's quite a hand...
1.context: NodeContext: Knowing/playful. Arc: Shadowheart is dedicated to Shar (and in this moment, enjoys resistance to a shadow curse that saps the strength of her companions)

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Halsin... were there ever wolves in these woods?
5.context: NodeContext: trying to sound casual, but thinking about her past, in which Sharrans kidnapped her while a wolf was pursuing. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: Once, certainly. But not for a hundred years. Any that still prowl this land can scarcely be called wolves any longer.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: I see... a hundred years is too far back, for what I had in mind. No matter.
2.context: NodeContext: A little disappointed. Perhaps wondering if she might have had a connection to the regjon, once. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.
